org.cougaar.core.plugin.deletion
Interface Deletable

public interface Deletable

A Blackboard object that can be deleted.

Deletion occurs when a blackboard object is no longer functionally significant subject to a DeletionPolicy that may extend the interval before an object is actually removed to support "best effort" retention of historical data. Actual deletion is performed by deletion plugins according to policies. Not all deletable blackboard objects implement this interface. It is only implemented for simple deletable objects for which the "is it time to delete" decision is uncomplicated.

Method Summary
 long getDeletionTime()
          Get the deletion time of this object.
 boolean isDeletable()
          Some Deletable objects are not actually deletable.

          Indicates that this object has been deleted and that remove events should be interpreted as deletion rather than rescind.

          Set the status of this object to "deleted" (isDeleted should return true).
 boolean useSystemTime()
          Specifies that the time returned by getDeletion() is based on the value of System.currentTimeMillis() rather than scenario time.
 

Method Detail

isDeletable

boolean isDeletable()
Some Deletable objects are not actually deletable. This method lets such objects declare whether they are deletable or not.

Returns:
true if the object with this interface can be deleted.

isDeleted

boolean isDeleted()
Indicates that this object has been deleted and that remove events should be interpreted as deletion rather than rescind.

Returns:
true if this object has been deleted.

setDeleted

void setDeleted()
Set the status of this object to "deleted" (isDeleted should return true). There is no argument because there is no provision for clearing the deleted status of an object.

getDeletionTime

long getDeletionTime()
Get the deletion time of this object. The deletion time, in conjunction with the applicable DeletionPolicy determines the earliest time when an object can be safely deleted. This time should be as early as possible consistent with correct operation. A DeletionPolicy should be used to extend the time an object remains on the blackboard for historical reasons.

Returns:
The time (scenario time) in milliseconds at which this object can be safely deleted.

useSystemTime

boolean useSystemTime()
Specifies that the time returned by getDeletion() is based on the value of System.currentTimeMillis() rather than scenario time.

Returns:
whether it uses scenario or system time
